definitions: tiny two-winged flying insect that often forms swarms near water
examples: Gnats swarmed around our picnic table relentlessly
She swatted at the persistent gnats near the pond

definitions: small humanoid creature from folklore, typically depicted as living underground
decorative statue of a bearded dwarf figure commonly placed in gardens
examples: Fairy tales often feature gnomes guarding hidden treasures
The garden gnome theory fascinated the folklore students
Their lawn featured three colorful gnomes by the flowerbed
Someone stole all the garden gnomes from the neighborhood

definitions: large African antelope with curved horns and a long face, also called wildebeest
examples: The gnu migration across the Serengeti attracts thousands of tourists
Lions stalked the gnu herd near the watering hole

definitions: stick with a pointed end used for driving cattle
something that provokes or stimulates someone into action or response
examples: The farmer used a goad to direct the stubborn oxen
Ancient herders carried goads for managing their livestock
Competition served as a goad to improve their performance
His criticism was the goad she needed to excel

definitions: something that you hope to achieve in the future
area or structure where players attempt to score in sports
successful scoring action or point earned in sports competitions
examples: Her goal was to graduate with honors next year
Setting clear goals helps maintain focus and motivation
The goalkeeper defended the goal against repeated attacks
They painted the goal posts before the match
He scored the winning goal in overtime
The team celebrated their first goal enthusiastically

definitions: player who defends the goal in sports like hockey or soccer
examples: The goalie made an incredible save in the final minutes
Their goalie sustained an injury during the second period

definitions: player positioned to prevent the opposing team from scoring goals
examples: The goalkeeper dove to block the penalty kick
Professional goalkeepers undergo specialized training programs

definitions: player who guards the goal in ice hockey, wearing specialized protective equipment
examples: The goaltender's mask deflected the dangerous puck
NHL goaltenders face shots exceeding ninety miles per hour

definitions: domesticated ruminant animal with horns and a beard
person blamed for a failure or mistake, especially in sports
examples: The goat climbed the rocky hillside effortlessly
Mountain goats can navigate nearly vertical cliff faces
He became the goat after missing the crucial shot
Nobody wanted to be the goat of the championship

definitions: bowl-shaped drinking cup, typically with a stem and base
examples: The silver goblet contained ceremonial wine for the toast
Medieval nobles drank from ornate goblets at feasts

definitions: small, grotesque supernatural being known for causing trouble or mischief
examples: The goblin stole shiny objects from unsuspecting travelers
Fantasy novels often feature goblins as minor antagonists

definitions: supreme being worshipped as having power over nature and human fortunes
person greatly admired or influential in a particular sphere
examples: Many cultures worship different gods with unique attributes
The ancient Greeks believed gods controlled natural phenomena
He was considered a god of rock music
Tennis fans treated her like a god after the victory

definitions: male sponsor at a child's baptism who promises religious education
head of a crime family or organization, especially in the Mafia
person who originates or helps develop something important
examples: His godfather attended every important milestone in his life
The godfather gave a touching speech at the christening
The godfather controlled criminal operations throughout the city
Police finally arrested the notorious godfather after years
James Brown is considered the godfather of soul music
He's the godfather of modern computer programming

definitions: female sponsor at a child's baptism who promises religious education
magical female character who helps someone, especially in fairy tales
examples: Her godmother sent birthday gifts every year without fail
The godmother held the baby during the baptism ceremony
Cinderella's fairy godmother transformed her for the ball
Every child dreams of having a fairy godmother

definitions: boy or man for whom someone acts as godparent at baptism
examples: His godson graduated from medical school with honors
The godfather left his estate to his beloved godson

definitions: person who regularly attends or goes to a particular place or event
examples: Regular gym goers noticed the new equipment immediately
Theater goers applauded enthusiastically after the performance

definitions: act of leaving or departing from a place
condition of ground or route for traveling or progress
examples: His going was sudden and unexpected to everyone
The going away party lasted until midnight
The going got tough when rain turned trails to mud
When the going gets rough, determination matters most

definitions: valuable yellow metallic element used for jewelry and currency
bright yellow color resembling the metal gold
medal or prize awarded for first place in competition
examples: The ring was made of pure gold and diamonds
Gold prices fluctuate based on global economic conditions
Her dress was a stunning shade of gold
The sunset painted the sky in gold and orange
She won gold at the Olympic games
The team brought home the gold trophy

definitions: plant with clusters of small bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer
examples: Fields of goldenrod announced the arrival of autumn
Goldenrod pollen causes allergic reactions in many people

definitions: small finch with bright yellow and black plumage that feeds on seeds
examples: Goldfinches gathered at the thistle feeder every morning
The American goldfinch is the state bird of Iowa

definitions: small orange or yellow fish commonly kept as a pet in bowls or aquariums
examples: The goldfish swam circles in its decorative bowl
Children won goldfish prizes at the carnival game

definitions: place where gold ore is extracted from the ground
source of great wealth or something very valuable and profitable
examples: The abandoned goldmine attracted curious explorers and historians
Workers discovered a new goldmine in the mountains
The website became a goldmine of historical information
Their patent portfolio proved to be a goldmine

definitions: artisan who works with gold to create jewelry and decorative objects
examples: The goldsmith crafted an intricate wedding band design
Medieval goldsmiths often served as early bankers

definitions: anthropomorphic being from Jewish folklore, magically created from inanimate matter like clay
examples: The rabbi created a golem to protect the community
Modern fiction often reimagines the golem mythology

definitions: outdoor sport where players use clubs to hit balls into holes with fewest strokes
examples: They played golf every Sunday morning at the country club
Professional golf tournaments attract millions of viewers worldwide

definitions: person who plays golf regularly or professionally
examples: The golfer carefully lined up her putt
Professional golfers spend hours practicing their swing

definitions: activity or sport of playing golf
examples: Weekend golfing helps executives relax and network
She took up golfing after retirement

definitions: biblical giant warrior defeated by David with a slingshot
person or thing of enormous size or power
examples: David's victory over Goliath symbolizes triumph over adversity
The story of David and Goliath inspires underdogs
The startup challenged the goliath of the tech industry
Their team faced a goliath in the tournament finals

definitions: traditional flat-bottomed boat used on Venetian canals
enclosed cabin suspended from cables for mountain transportation
examples: The gondola glided silently through Venice's narrow canals
Tourists rode gondolas serenaded by singing gondoliers
The ski resort's gondola carried visitors to the summit
They took the gondola up the mountain for lunch

definitions: large flat circular metal disc that produces deep resonant sound when struck
examples: The gong signaled the start of the meditation session
Orchestra musicians struck the gong for dramatic effect

definitions: sexually transmitted bacterial infection affecting the genital tract, throat, or rectum
examples: Regular testing helps detect gonorrhea in its early stages
Antibiotics effectively treat gonorrhea when prescribed properly

definitions: thick, sticky, viscous substance that is often messy
examples: The children got sticky goo all over their hands
Mystery goo leaked from the broken container

definitions: word or gesture used when parting from someone or leaving
examples: She waved goodbye from the departing train window
Saying goodbye to old friends proved emotionally difficult

definitions: friendly, helpful, or cooperative feelings or attitude toward others
established reputation of a business regarded as a quantifiable asset
examples: The treaty promoted goodwill between the neighboring nations
Holiday season generates goodwill among community members
The company's goodwill was valued at ten million dollars
They paid extra for the business's established goodwill

definitions: something attractive, desirable, or pleasing, especially something sweet to eat
examples: Children eagerly grabbed goodies from the party bag
The conference provided various goodies for attendees

definitions: foolish mistake or error, often minor or humorous
person who is silly or makes frequent mistakes
examples: His goof during the presentation made everyone laugh
The typo was just a minor goof in the report
Don't be such a goof during the serious meeting
The class goof always entertained his classmates

definitions: person hired to intimidate or use violence, especially for criminal purposes
stupid, foolish, or awkward person
examples: The mob boss sent goons to collect the debt
Security removed the goons causing trouble at the venue
Stop acting like a goon and be serious
The goon tripped over his own feet repeatedly

definitions: large waterbird with long neck, webbed feet, and honking call
examples: Wild geese flew south in perfect V formation
The goose chased visitors who ventured too close

definitions: small round edible berry that grows on thorny bushes, usually green or red
examples: Grandmother made delicious gooseberry pie every summer
Gooseberries require careful picking due to thorny branches

definitions: small burrowing rodent with fur-lined cheek pouches native to North America
examples: Gophers created extensive tunnel systems throughout the yard
The gopher popped its head out of the hole

definitions: blood that has been shed, especially from violence or injury
triangular piece of material used in making garments, sails, or umbrellas
examples: The horror movie featured excessive gore and violence
Crime scene investigators documented the gore carefully
The seamstress added gores to widen the skirt
Umbrella gores create the dome shape when opened

definitions: narrow valley between hills or mountains with steep rocky walls
act of eating greedily or to excess
examples: The river carved a deep gorge through the mountains
Hikers carefully descended into the spectacular gorge
The holiday gorge left everyone feeling uncomfortably full
Bears gorge on salmon before winter hibernation

definitions: largest living primate, native to African forests, with powerful build and dark hair
examples: Mountain gorillas live in small family groups
The silverback gorilla protected his troop vigilantly

definitions: young goose, especially one still covered with down feathers
examples: The goslings followed their mother in single file
Fluffy yellow goslings paddled across the pond

definitions: teachings of Jesus and the apostles as recorded in the New Testament
something accepted as absolutely true or reliable
religious music originating in African American churches characterized by dominant vocals
examples: The minister preached the gospel every Sunday morning
Four gospels describe the life of Jesus Christ
She took his advice as gospel without questioning
Financial advisors shouldn't treat theories as gospel
The choir sang gospel music with passionate enthusiasm
Gospel singers moved the congregation to tears

definitions: light, delicate, translucent fabric or material
fine filaments of spider silk seen floating in air or on grass
examples: Her wedding veil was made of gossamer material
The fairy costume featured gossamer wings
Morning dew clung to gossamer threads across the garden
Gossamer floated on the autumn breeze

definitions: casual or unconstrained conversation about other people, typically involving unverified details
person who habitually reveals personal or sensational facts about others
examples: Office gossip spread quickly about the upcoming layoffs
Celebrity gossip fills countless magazine pages
The neighborhood gossip knew everyone's business
Don't tell her secrets; she's a terrible gossip

definitions: chisel with concave blade used for cutting grooves or holes
groove, hole, or indentation made by gouging
examples: The woodworker used a gouge to carve decorative patterns
Different sized gouges created various curved cuts
Deep gouges in the table showed years of use
The accident left a gouge in the car door

definitions: large fleshy fruit with hard skin, some varieties edible, others used as containers
examples: Decorative gourds adorned the autumn centerpiece
Ancient peoples used hollow gourds as water vessels

definitions: person who enjoys and appreciates fine food and drink
food that is of very high quality or exotic preparation
examples: The gourmet recommended the restaurant's tasting menu
Food gourmets traveled worldwide seeking culinary experiences
The store specialized in gourmet cheeses and wines
They prepared a gourmet meal for the anniversary
